projectDesc.p: The project DHARMA has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement no 809994).

prefixDef.p: Public URIs with the prefix bib to point to a Zotero Group Library named ERC-DHARMA whose data are open to the public.
Internal URIs using the part prefix to point to person elements in the DHARMA_idListMembers_v01.xml file.

revisionDesc.change: Version 3.2 : moving the xml:lang to the root
Version 3.1: adding the encodingDesc and linking the template with the DHARMA Schema
Version 2: addition of handDesc and summary

div.head: Front
div.ab:
// Oṃ AvīghnamAvighnam astu gaṇapataye namaḥ // svasti śaka-varṣātīta[133] 851 baiśākha-māsa tithi navamī śukla-pakṣa ma U
ca[134] vāra pūrvvaphālguṇī-nakṣatra, yoṇi-devatā, Āyuṣmān-yoga, Irikā divaśa rakryān· hujuṁ pu madhura lokānu-
rāñjanalokānurañjana, manambaḥ I śrī mahārāja rake halu pu siṇḍok· śrī Īśānavikrama dharmmottuṅgadeva, sumīma Ikāṁ dmak ṣavaḥ I
guluṅ-guluṁ tapak· su 7, muAṁ Alas· I bantaran· satṅaḥ, paknānya dharmmakṣetrā savahani kuśala rakryān· hujuṁ saṁ hyaṁ[136]
prāsāda I himad·,[137] maṅasəA I saṁ hyaṁ kahyaṅan· I paṅavān· mapaṅasəA[138] vḍus·[139] 1 pāda 1 Aṁkən kapūjān· bhaṭāra I pa-
ṅavān· Iṁ prativarṣa, Āpan· ṅkai gunuṁ vaṅkḍi mūla kahyaṅan· saṁ hyaṁ I paṅavān· riṁ purāṇa, mataṅyan tuṅgala gatyanikaṁ[140]
saṁ hyaṁ kahyaṅan· kapva siliḥ lavada sakarmmaṇya[141] I paṅavān· muAṁ I himad· yan· tkaniṁ[142] kapūjān· bhaṭāra I paṅavā-
n· Umilva sakarmmaṇya[143] I himad· tkaniṁ kapūjān· bhaṭāra I himad· Ilva sakarmmaṇya[144] I paṅavān· Iṁ biśuva kāla-
n·[145] prasiddha tuṅgal·[146] bhaṭāra maṅadhiṣṭhāna I himad· I paṅavān· muAṁ hana ta sīma putrasva I batvan· muAṁ I curu
Iy air gilaṁ I gapuk·, I sbaṁ[147] paknānya maṅasəA I saṁ hyaṁ prāsāda I himad·, kramani paṅasə:nya I batvan· śīkhāha
pañjat·[148] I curu lṅa vatu sukat· 1, kalapa 20 mā 1 Iy air gilaṁ Iṅa vatu sukat· 20 mā 2 Iṁ gapuk· [149]
mā 1 maṅkana kramani paṅasə:nikanaṁ sīma putrasva mijila Aṅkən· biṣuva riṁ kapūjān·[150] bhaṭāra ri himad·, maṁkana sa-
mbaḥ[151] rakryān· hujuṁ I śrī mahārāja tlas sinanmata, matəhər ta ya pinagəhakan· Inarpaṇākan·[152] rakryān· hujuṁ I saṁ hyaṁ prā-
sāda[153] An· sīmā savaha saṁ hyaṁ prāsāda I himad· paknānya svatantrā tan katamāna deni patiḥ vahuta rāma, nāyaka partta-
ya[154] pamgat·[155] ṅunivaiḥ saprakāraniṁ maṅilala drabya haji riṁ daṅū miśra-paramiśra vulu-vulu prakāra paṅuraṁ kriṁ· paḍam· manimpi-
ki paranakan· limus galuḥ, paṅaruhan·, taji vatu tajam·, sukun·, halu varak· rakadut· pinilai kataṅgaran·,[156] tapa haji
Air haji, malandaṁ, L̥ca, L̥bə-L̥b·[157] kalaṁkaṁ kutak·, taṅkil·, tr̥pan·, saluIt·, tuha dagaṁ, tuha gusali, maṁrumbai maṅguñjai tu-
hān nambi, tuhān· huñjamman·, vatu valaṁ, pamaṇikan·, maṇiga, sikpan·, rumban·, vilaṁ vanuA, viji kavaḥ, tiṅkəs·, māvi[158]
tuhāñ ju[ḍ]i, juru jalir·, miśra hino, vli hapū, vli tambaṁ, vli pañjut·, vli haR̥ṁ, palamak·, pakaluṅkuṁ Urutan·,[159] dampulan·
tpuṁ kavuṁ, suṁ-suṁ paṅuraṁ, pasuk alas·, payuṅan·, puluṁ paḍi, pabisar·, paguluṁ, pāṅinn-aṅin·, sipat bilut·, pāmavaśya, ho-
pan·,[160] turun-turun·, panrāṅan·, skar[161] tahun·, panusuḥ, pahaliman·, kḍi valyan·, vidu, maṅiduṁ, sambal sumbul·, hulun· ha-
ji pamr̥si, vatakk i jro, Ityaivammādi tan· tamā Irikanaṁ sīma kevala saṁ hyaṁ parhyaṅan·, pramāṇā I sadrabya-hajinya
kabaiḥ, maṅkana Ikanaṁ sukhaduḥkha kady aṅganiṁ mayaṁ tan mavuAḥ valū rumambat· Iṁ natar·, vipati vaṅkay· kābunan·, rāḥ kasa-
vur iṁ[162] dalan· vākcapalā duhilatan· hastacapalā mamtuAkan· vūriniṅ kikir· mamuk·, mamumpaṁ, lūdan·, tūtan·, ḍa-
ṇḍa kuḍaṇḍa bhaṇḍihalādi bhaṭāra riṁ prāsāda Ataḥ parānani sadrabya-hajinya kunaṁ Ikāṁ miśra mañambul·, mañavriṁ maṁlā-
kha, maṅapus·, mapahaṅan·, matarub·[163] manūla vuṅkuḍu, maṁdyun·, maṅubar·,[164] maṁhapū, maṁluruṁ,[165] magavai ruṅki, payuṁ vlu mopiḥ, maka-
jaṁ Agavai kisi, maṅanam-anam·, mamubut·, manavaṁ, makala-kalā, mamisaṇḍuṁ manuk·, bhaṭāra ri prāsāda Ataḥ pramāṇa I sadrabya-
hajinya, samaṅkana Ikanaṁ parahu[166] pavalijān· 1, masuṁhara[167] 2 tan· patuṇḍāna, Adagaṁ[168] kapas·, vuṅkuḍu, Abasana kalima bantal·
Aṅuñjal·[169] 1 paṇḍai vsi satarub·, paṇḍai mas· 1 paṇḍai tambaga 1 kaṁsa 1 Aṅulaṁ kbo savurugan· sapi prāṇa 3 vḍus·
saparaṅgaṁ[170] Aṅulaṅ aṇḍaḥ satarub·, samaṅkana kramanikaṁ sīma tan· knā[171] I saluĪrniṁ drabya haji saprakāra, Irikanaṁ kā-

div.head: Back
div.ab:
la maṅasəAkan·[172] rakryān· hujuṁ pasək·-pasək·, I śrī mahārāja mas· su 5 vḍihan· tapiś cadar· yu 1 muAṁ I ra-
kryān·[173] kabaiḥ, kapuA vinaiḥ pasək·-pasək· kāyānurūpa, rakai sirikan· dyah amarendra, vka dyaḥ balyaṁ, rakryān· mo-
mah-umaḥ kāliḥ maḍaṇdər· pu padma, Aṅgəhan· pu kuṇḍala, tiruan· ḍapunta taritip· InaṁsəAn· pasək· mā 1, vḍiha-
n· tapiś cadar· yu 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, halaran· pu guṇottama, InaṁsəAn· pasək· mā 1, vḍihan· ragi yu 1 mamrāti havaṁ[174]
vicakṣaṇa, maṁhūri[175] pu paṇḍamuan·, tilimpik· pu dhanuka, dalinan· pu karṣaṇa, vinaiḥ pasək· mā 5 vḍihan· ragi yu
1[176] sovaṁ-sovaṁ, vadihati saṁ dinakara, Akudur· pu balavān· vinaiḥ pasək· ma 1, vḍihan· ragi yu 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ,
tuhān· I vadihati 2 miraḥ-miraḥ, saṁ halaṁ pahuṁ,[177] halaran· saṁ lbūr[178] poḥ, tuhān· I makudur· 2 vatu valeṁ saṁ ra majjha,[179] va-
tu kiluṁ[180] saṁ tpussən· vinaiḥ pasək· mā 5 vḍihan· ragi yu 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, paṅuraṁ I vadihati saṁ ra vuṅū, Anuṅgū saṁ ho-
ṅka[181] paṅuraṁ I makudur· saṁ ra kvəl·, Anuṅgū saṁ kulumpaṁ[182] vinaiḥ pasək· mā 2 ku 2 vḍihan· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, saṁ tuhān· I
pakaraṇān· juru kanayakān· samgat· gunuṅan· pu tuntun·,[183] juru vadva rarai saṁ ra guyu, juru kalula pu bālī, kaṇḍamuhi punta geṣṭa
vatu[184] varaṇi saṁ nidhi, parujar· I sirikan· hujuṁ galuḥ I vka viridiḥ, I kanuruhan· rokat·, I sbaṁ saṁ vimala, I srāṅan· saṁ sa-
tyaka,[185] I madaṇḍər saṁ cakra, ryy āṅgəhan· saṁ vidya, I tiruAn· sumuḍan· punta saṅgama vinaiḥ pasək· mā 1, kinabaihāni-
ra[186] lumaku manusuk· I vadihati saṁ ra və:han·,[187] I makudur· saṁ ra mājha[188] vinaiḥ pasək· mas· su 2 mā 8 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, paṅaṅka-
t·[189] I saṁ hyaṁ kudur· mas· su 5 hop saji[190] pomah-umaḥ prakāra dakṣiṇa saṁ hyaṁ brahmā mā 1 saṁ hyaṁ lambu mā 1, saṁ hyaṁ su-
suk· vḍihan· yu 1 vḍihan·nire vadihati makudur· yu 2 siṁhəl·nira yu 1, patiḥ juru kāliḥ vasaḥ[191] saṁ kayu matə:b·,[192] kuci
saṁ būka[193] vinaiḥ pasək· mā 5 vḍihan· ragi yu 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, parujarnya piṅsor hyaṁ paskaran·[194] vinaiḥ mā 2 ku 2 sovaṁ-sovaṁ
patiḥ kahyunnan· puntani turus·[195] saṁ ḍumpil·, varaṇā, saṅ ambata, saṁ smī, vinaiḥ mā 2[196] vḍihan· ragi yu 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, patiḥ ka-
hyunan[197] maṅharR̥p· babak· rikaṁ kāla saṁ lāgi[198] vinaiḥ mā 5 vḍihan· ragi yu 1 vargga patiḥ Anakbi Ilu kinannān· pasək· saṁ baraṇa[199]
Anakbi[200] saṁ najī Ibuni marapi, saṁ kbək· vinaiḥ mā 2 kain· vlaḥ[201] 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, vargga patiḥ kahyunan· laki-laki vinaiḥ pasə-
k· harivaṅsa, bāṇa, juraṁ,[202] daṅkal·, marapi, vinaiḥ mā 2 vḍihan· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, patiḥ pamgat· saṁ jarā, maṁhambi-
n·[203] saṁ balusyak·[204] vinaiḥ pasək· mā 4 vḍihan· ragi yu 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, juru vanuA saṁ hīra panulisan· prathama, maṇiga
vinaiḥ[205] mā 2 vḍihan· yu 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, parujar patiḥ kahyunan· bisat·[206] parujar· patiḥ samgat· babus·, parujar maṁ-
hambinanī[207] gusti[208] pañjuruAn·[209] I pakāraṇān· Astuti, malavaṅ[210] kāliḥ jaṅga krāndhaḥ, panaṅlar· bhoma, Ugal-ugal·[211] səvur·[212]
juru kalaṁ[213] sambī, tajuṅkilan·[214] mḍaṁ gəntər·[215] vinaiḥ mā 1 vḍihan· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, vahuta paṅuñjaṅan· dhavala kamasi-
han·[216] putra laguntan· Unak·[217] vinaiḥ pasək· mā 4[218] vḍihan· ragi yu 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, taṇḍa rakryān· Ilu pinakasākṣī[219] rikaṁ
kāla, kanuruhan· dyaḥ mumpaṁ, vaharu pu kalumpaṁ, vinaiḥ pasək· mas· su 1 mā 4 vḍihan· paḍi[221] hlai 1[222] sovaṁ-sovaṁ saṁ tu-
hān·[223] I kanuruhan· saṁ ra baṇir saṁ ra vujaṁ,[224] vuṅkal kiluṁ, saṁ părtha, vinaiḥ mas· su 1 mā 4 kinabaihānnira vḍihan· ragi hlai 1 so-
vaṁ-sovaṁ,[225] tpi siriṁ Ilu pinakasākṣī rakryān·, juru gotra I kanuruhan· rakai paṅambuhan·,[226] rakai siñjalan·[227] vinaiḥ mā 4[228] vḍi-
han·[229] yu 1[230] sovaṁ-sovaṁ, gotra I tampuran· saṁ mādhava bapa dyaḥ damū muAṁ dyaḥ damū, vinaiḥ mā 2 vḍihan· hlai 1
sovaṁ-sovaṁ devata kaki I balaṇḍit· saṁ śivarāśi vineḥ pasək· mā 4 punta I paṅavan· Uṅgər·[231] pramukha, vinaiḥ

div.ab:
pasək· mā 4 kinabaihannira patiḥ tpi si-
riṁ vinaiḥ[232] pasək· karūman·[233] I
kanuruhan· saṁ jātaḥ,[234] maṅhambin·[235]
saṁ hiraṇya, patiḥ pamgat·
saṁ prakaśita,[236] patiḥ I tuga-
ran· paṅajaran· saṁ malaḥ,[237] patiḥ

pasək· mā 4 vḍihan· yu 1 so-
vaṁ-sovaṁ, samaṁṅkana kvaiḥnira
ilu[238] pinakasākṣī hinanākə-
n· kālaniṁ manusuk· ri tlas· I
saṁ mapatiḥ vahuta rāma tpi si-

non·[240] ta sira mapaktya, malūṅguḥ[241] ya-
thākrama, Irikāṁ tkan· pasak·
lor· kidul·, kuluAn· veta-
n· Irikāṅ kalaṅan·[242] ri himad·
tumama ta saṁ mavaju haji ri kala-
ṅan· ri pkan· ri himad· maglar saji suma-
ṅaskāra[243] saṁ hyaṁ susuk· saṅkap· sakrama-
niṁ daṅū[244] manətək· hayam mamantiṅa-
kan·[245] hantiga I saṁ hyaṁ vatu təAs· su-
suk·[246] pamaṁmaṁ[247] hyaṁ manapathe liṁnira[248]
Īndaḥ ta kita kamuṁ hyaṁ I śrī bapra-
keśvara śrī haricandana Agasti mahā-

ravi śaśī kṣiti jala pavana hutāsana
yajamānākāśa[251] dharmma Ahorātra[252]

div.ab:
sura
gandharvva yama
baruṇa kuvaira bāsava muAṁ
putra devatā pañcakuśika nā-
garājā dūrggadevī caturāśra[254]

An·[270] hulun· gr̥hasta viku yā-

div.ab:
hara-hara saṅkap· vulu ka-
ṇḍari kaḍivas· ḍeṁ hañaṁ ḍeṁ
hasin· saL̥r· capa-capa, ruma-
han· huraṁ biluṁluṁ hala-ha-
la hantiga Inariṁ, vulūniṁ[288] ga-
ṅan· miśāka,[289] Atak·[290] sisir·
takiḥ, kasyan· lil-lit·[291] gāṁ-
ṅān· tlu saranak· Alap-alap·

div.head: Right upper part
div.ab:
baiḥ[296] vasiha gaṅan· vinai-
han· ta sira jnu skar· tlas saṅkap· mu-
vaḥ ta sira manaḍaḥ yathāsu-
kha men-men· rakryan·
kahaḍaṁ[297] rikaṁ kāla ka-
puA Umintonnakan· guṇa-
nya, Atapukan vuvus pramukha[298]
vinaiḥ mā[299] 4[300] kinabaihanya, A-
vayaṁ kaluṅasua śravaṇa vi-
naiḥ mā 4 kinabaihanya, Aba-
ñol· si livu_ _han· hi-
tip·-pramukha vinaiḥ mā
4 kinabaihanya, cihna-
nyan· tlas· mapagəḥ
[301]

app.note: Our reading confirms the reconstruction by Damais (1955: 156).
D stops reading at this point. B reads həmad in all occurrences of this toponym. We shall not report further instances of this variant reading below.

the reading is clear but the word form is unacceptable as it stands and might best be treated as superfluous altogether. Or we could accept a redundant repetition of maṅasəA by treating only the pa as superfluous.
At the end of this line, races of akṣaras can still be seen but are difficult to decipher. B reads ruAṁ … (rimpaṁ) and N has ruAṁ … niṁ ... while T does not provide any reading.
T’s restitution may be correct but ours is more plausible, as the reading parttaya is considerably better attested than pratyaya in the corpus of Sindok inscriptions.
Cf. Jeru-Jeru A19.
B and N silently correct the reading.
Cf. Sangguran B4 (guṇuṅan· pu tun·tun·) and Masahar B9 (gunuṅan pu tuntun·). The parallel passage in Jeru-Jeru B1 which reads vuntun· also shows omission of one akṣara.
B notes an alternative reading matəb·.
B silently correcting the reading.
Cf. Jeru-Jeru B12 pr̥thama, maṇiga L̥kər·, barsahan· samə, vineḥ.
Cf. Jeru-Jeru B13.
Restored after Jeru-Jeru B13 parujar patiḥ maṁhambin nanī, pañjuruAn· Iṁ pakaraṇan· Astuti malavaṁ kāliḥ jaṅga. But note that gusti is absent there.
Cf. Jeru-Jeru B16.

app.lem: pasək· mā 4 kinabaihannira patiḥ tpi siriṁ vinaiḥ
app.note: Supplied from the parallel in Jeru-Jeru B20–21.

Having observed the trace of the akṣaras and the availability of space, some of the expected readings such sandhyā hr̥daya (Linggasuntan B24), sandhyādvaya (Jeru-Jeru B27), sandhyā (Paradah I 2A29), and even the reading dvaya suggested by N do not seems possible.

The akṣaras on the 1st through 4th lines are lost. We follow N in the restoration of the text provided here, where B and T do not provide any. However, we have replaced the segment śvino supplied by N based on the parallel in Jeru-Jeru, to muAṁ putra devatā: see the explanation on this matter in our note on Jeru-Jeru c1. The parallel passage in Linggasuntan B24–25 is pretāsūra I garuḍa gandarvva catvāri lokapāla, yama buruṇa kuvera bāśava muAṁ putra devatā pañcakuśika nandīśvāra mahākāla ṣadvināyaka nāgarāja durggadevī caturāśra while in Jeru-Jeru B27–c3 it is pretāsura, garuḍa kinnara gandharvva, yama baruṇa kuvaira bāsava Aśvinodeva, pañca kuśika, nandīśvara mahākāla ṣadvināyaka nāgarājā, dūrggādevī, caturāśra.
Cf. Jeru-Jeru c18–19.
Cf. Jeru-Jeru d5..
The stone is quite worn here, so our tentative reading is based mainly on the parallel in Jeru-Heru d11.

app.lem: saprakāra vinuvuhakan· tadanantara patṅaḥ manaḍaḥ kinon· sira kabaiḥ
app.note: The restoration is based on the parallel in Jeru-Jeru d12–14.

Commenting on his reading kahanān·, T notes that “bacaan ini kurang menyakinkan karena ada satu atau dua aksara yang sangat sulit dibaca (tertutup oleh percikan semen)". Our reading is based on the parallel in Jeru-Jeru d16–17.
The end of the inscription can probably to restored after the ending of Jeru-Jeru (d23–34): ... tlas· mapa[gəḥ] kasīmān·n ikāṁ sīma, katguhaknanira kabaiḥ.

div.p: We have used Nakada’s edition (N, 1990: 2–21) as base text. However, his edition does not include the reading of the left and right upper parts. We compared it to the editions by Trigangga (T, 2003_01: 10–16) and Brandes (B, 1913: 63–69, OJO XXXVIII), as well as the reading furnished by Damais (D, 1955: 104–105) only for the first 5 lines. (Note that, contrary to the Linggasuntan charter, Trigangga’s 2003 edition for the present charter is not republished in Hasan Djafar & Trigangga 2019.) Our edition was then prepared through direct inspection of the stone at MNI by Eko Bastiawan in March 2023, benefiting from remote supervision and assistance by Arlo Griffiths.
